rev.comment: /* Domestic responses */ Ahmad Zewail and Amr Khaled added
rev.diff:
Line 139: Line 139:
=== Domestic responses ===
=== Domestic responses ===
[[Mohammed ElBaradei]] called for ousting the regime, as in Tunisia.<ref name="Egyptians should copy Tunisian revolt">[http://www.zawya.com/story.cfm/sidANA20110122T190139ZNYZ32/?relcontent=ZW20110127000145 ElBaradei: Egyptians should copy Tunisian revolt]</ref> He said he was "proud of the protesters" and proud of the military, who by 29 January were the only state force on the streets of Cairo, with police nowhere to be seen. There were numerous individual public displays of affection and respect for soldiers manning positions on the streets.<ref>Al Jazeera English, TV report, 29 January, 12.00 GMT</ref>
[[Mohammed ElBaradei]] called for ousting the regime, as in Tunisia.<ref name="Egyptians should copy Tunisian revolt">[http://www.zawya.com/story.cfm/sidANA20110122T190139ZNYZ32/?relcontent=ZW20110127000145 ElBaradei: Egyptians should copy Tunisian revolt]</ref> He said he was "proud of the protesters" and proud of the military, who by 29 January were the only state force on the streets of Cairo, with police nowhere to be seen. There were numerous individual public displays of affection and respect for soldiers manning positions on the streets.<ref>Al Jazeera English, TV report, 29 January, 12.00 GMT</ref>
  +   +
[[Amr Khaled]], ''[[Egyptians|Egyptian]] [[Muslim]] televangelist, activist and preacher'', said the future of our country needs a government to listen to the young people and respecting them.<ref>{{ar}}{{cite web|url=http://ara.reuters.com/article/topNews/idARACAE70R1K020110128|title=Ø§ÙØ¯Ø§Ø¹ÙØ© Ø§ÙÙØµØ±Ù Ø¹ÙØ±Ù Ø®Ø§ÙØ¯ ÙØªÙØ¬Ù Ø§ÙÙ Ø§ÙÙØ§ÙØ±Ø©|author=|date=28 January 2011|work=|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=30 January 2011}}</ref>
  +   +
[[Ahmed Zewail]], ''([[Egyptians|Egyptian]]-[[United States|American]] scientist, and the winner of the 1999 [[Nobel Prize in Chemistry]])'', said that Egypt can not resolve the crisis without changing the system. He offered a proposal of the four items to remove Egypt from the current crisis and entered a new era. He said that reason for this proposal is his sense of duty towards Egypt and its youth.<ref>{{ar}}{{cite web|url=http://www.almasry-alyoum.com/article2.aspx?ArticleID=285805&IssueID=2025|title=Ø§ÙÙÙØ§Ø¦Ø³ Ø§ÙÙØ³ÙØ­ÙØ© Ø§ÙØ«ÙØ§Ø« ØªØ±ÙØ¶ ÙØ¸Ø§ÙØ±Ø§Øª Ù¢Ù¥ ÙÙØ§ÙØ±.. ÙØªØ·Ø§ÙØ¨ Ø§ÙØ£ÙØ¨Ø§Ø· Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯Ù Ø§ÙÙØ´Ø§Ø±ÙØ©|author=|date=24 January 2011|work=|publisher=Al Masry Al Youm|accessdate=29 January 2011}}</ref>
The head of the [[Shura Council|Egyptian Shura Council]]'s Foreign Affairs and Defense Committee, and also a part of the ruling party, said he does not believe the protests have ended yet.<ref>Breaking News. Al Jazeera English. 29 January 2011. ~2:00</ref>
The head of the [[Shura Council|Egyptian Shura Council]]'s Foreign Affairs and Defense Committee, and also a part of the ruling party, said he does not believe the protests have ended yet.<ref>Breaking News. Al Jazeera English. 29 January 2011. ~2:00</ref>
